means: 责骂，责备( chide的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: She was chiding her son for not being more dutiful to her.
sentence.Network_cn: 她在责骂她儿子对她不够孝尽.

sentence.Network_en: She called back her scattered maidens, chiding their alarm.
sentence.Network_cn: 她把受惊的少女们召唤回来, 对她们的惊惶之状加以指责.

sentence.Network_en: The old caretaker was always scolding and chiding.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个老看门人总是责骂,呵叱个没完.

PerfectNetExp.abs: While all the world were chiding , ., 当整个世界都在叫骂的时候!

list.abs: mother chided me for coming home late .母亲责怪我回家太迟。
the presiding judge chided the police forplanting the cellmate and dismissed the evidence as not credible .首席法官斥责警方安插囚友，拒绝承认证据的可信性。
Simon asked , then silently chided himself for interrupting ., Simon 问 , 随即 , 默默责备自己又打断了对方的话.
You ' re being childish , I chided myself ., 太幼稚了 , 我责备自己.

entry.def: If you chide someone, you speak to them angrily because they have done something wicked or foolish.

example.tran: 克罗斯怨怪自己瞎操心。

example.ex: He gently chided the two women.
example.tran: 他温和地责备了那两名女子。

auth_sentence.content: You came chiding into the world.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: You came chiding into the world.

auth_sentence.content: Environmental groups are chiding the government for not going far enough to impose new safety measures on the petroleum industry.
auth_sentence.res_content: Environmental groups are chiding the government for not going far enough to impose new safety measures on the petroleum industry.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Environmental groups are chiding the government for not going far enough to impose new safety measures on the petroleum industry.

auth_sentence.content: Far from chiding the old man for his fabrications, he is fondly and supportively amused.
auth_sentence.res_content: Far from chiding the old man for his fabrications, he is fondly and supportively amused.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Far from chiding the old man for his fabrications, he is fondly and supportively amused.
